events.description: The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged as expected.

facts.fact_text: The ECB left interest rates unchanged.

evidences.evidence_text: the European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged as expected.

facts.fact_text: The ECB expects inflation to stabilize at its 2% target over the medium term.

evidences.evidence_text: The ECB reiterated that inflation is expected to stabilize at its 2% target over the medium term

facts.fact_text: Eurostat data showed headline inflation eased to 1.7% year on year in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Separately, Eurostat data showed headline inflation eased to 1.7% year on year in January, matching expectations and marking the lowest reading since September 2024.

facts.fact_text: Core inflation slowed to 2.2%, the weakest since October 2021.

evidences.evidence_text: Core inflation also slowed to 2.2%, slightly below forecasts and the weakest since October 2021.

claims.claim_text: Some ECB officials cautioned that further euro appreciation could revive the case for additional rate cuts.
claims.author: ECB officials

evidences.evidence_text: although some officials have cautioned that further euro appreciation could revive the case for additional rate cuts.

evidence.evidence_text: Euro Steadies After ECB Holds Rates
The ECB reiterated that inflation is expected to stabilize at its 2% target over the medium term
the euro area economy remains resilient despite an uncertain outlook driven by global trade policy risks and ongoing geopolitical tensions.
although some officials have cautioned that further euro appreciation could revive the case for additional rate cuts.
while noting that the euro area economy remains resilient despite an uncertain outlook driven by global trade policy risks and ongoing geopolitical tensions.
